messages:
[{'role': 'user', 'content': '
        Task: Calculate PVGIS solar potential for San francisco, Larkin Street and extract coordinates
        
        Steps:
        1. Open Firefox
        2. Go to https://re.jrc.ec.europa.eu/pvg_tools/en/
        3. Type "San francisco, Larkin Street" in the Address field and click "Go!" button
        4. Wait for the map to center on the location
        5. Look at the right panel and find the "Selected:" coordinates (e.g., "48.375, 3.140")
        6. In the orange "PERFORMANCE OF GRID-CONNECTED PV" panel, configure:
           - PV technology: Crystalline silicon (should be already selected)
           - Installed peak PV power: 5 (change from 1 to 5)
           - System loss: 14 (keep default)
           - Mounting position: Free-standing (keep default)
           - Slope: 35 (keep default)
           - Azimuth: 0 (keep default)
        7. Click "Visualize results" (blue button)
        8. Wait for the results page to load (orange background)
        9. Find the "Simulation outputs:" section and read:
           - "Yearly PV energy production [kWh]:" value
           - "Yearly in-plane irradiation [kWh/m²]:" value
        
        MANDATORY: End your response with exactly this format:
        "EXTRACTED DATA:
        Coordinates: [latitude], [longitude]
        Production: [value] kWh
        Irradiation: [value] kWh/m²"
        
        Replace [latitude], [longitude] with the exact coordinates from "Selected:" field
        Replace [value] with the exact numbers from simulation outputs
        '}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': [BetaTextBlock(citations=None, text="I'll help you calculate the PVGIS solar potential for San Francisco, Larkin Street. Let me start by taking a screenshot to see the current state of the desktop.", type='text'), BetaToolUseBlock(id='toolu_0179Cd3iJrwpJ9WEaPAhbbib', input={'action': 'screenshot'}, name='computer', type='tool_use')]}, {'role': 'user', 'content': [{'type'
